RANDOMIZED_CONTROLLED_MULTI_CENTRE_STUDY: A Randomized Controlled Multicentre Study evaluating changes in Cardiovascular Risk Factors in Smokers with type 2 Diabetes Mellitus after switching from Tobacco Cigarettes to Combustion-Free Nicotine Delivery Systems: SMILE STUDY.
STUDY_AIMS_THE_HYPOTHESIS: This study aims to test the hypothesis that avoiding exposure to cigarette smoke toxicants may translate to measurable improvement in cardiovascular risk factors and functional parameters when type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) patients who smoke switch to using C-F NDS compared with T2DM patients who continue to smoke conventional tobacco products.
PARTICIPANTS_WILL_BE_RANDOMIZED: Participants will be randomized (1:2 ratio) to either continue to smoke commercially manufactured cigarettes (Study Arm A) or combustion-free nicotine delivery systems (C-F NDS) (Study Arm B).
BEFORE_RANDOMIZATION_ALL_SMOKERS_WILL_BE: Before randomization, all smokers will be reminded of the risks associated with smoking and will be offered a free smoking cessation program according to standard local guidelines and depending on the local availability of antismoking services. Those who decline the invitation will be eligible for recruitment into the RCT.
PARTICIPANTS_WILL_BE_INVITED_TO_FIVE_STU: Following a screening visit, participants will be invited to five study visits over a 24 month period, and will undergo a range of measurements and blood tests.
FUNDER_AND_SPONSOR: Funder & Sponsor: Prof. Riccardo Polosa, MD, PhD Director ECLAT Srl.

INSERT_INCLUSION_CRITERIA_AS_PER_PROTOCO: Insert Inclusion Criteria As Per Protocol
hasWillingnessToParticipateBySign: Demonstrate understanding of the study and willingness to participate in the study by providing a signed written informed consent
isHealthySubject: Healthy subjects, not taking regular medications for chronic medical conditions
hasWillingnessToParticipateWithDevice: Willingness and ability to comply with the requirements of the study including installing an APP on their digital device, e.g. smartphone or tablet
hasSmokedAtLeastFiveYears: Smoked for at least five consecutive years prior to Screening
hasExhaledBreathCoMoreThanSeven: With an exhaled breath CO level ≥7 ppm at Screening
hasWillingnessToSwitch: Willing to switch using study products if randomized to Arm B or to continue smoking their own brand of conventional cigarettes if randomized to Arm A (for the whole duration of the study)
hasNeverSmoked: Never smoked or who have smoked < 100 conventional cigarettes in their lifetime and none in the 30 days prior to screening
hasExhaledBreathCoLessThanSeven: With an exhaled breath CO level < 7 ppm at screening
hasWillingnessNotToSmoke: Willing to not smoke or use any form of tobacco or nicotine-containing products for the whole duration of the study
IF_ANY_OF_THE_ABOVE_CRITERIA_IS_ANSWERED: If any of the above criteria is answered NO, the subject is not eligible for the trial and must not be included in the study.
If any of the above criteria is answered YES, the subject is not eligible for the trial and must not be included in the study.
INSERT_EXCLUSION_CRITERIA_AS_PER_PROTOCO: Insert Exclusion Criteria As Per Protocol
hasSignificantOralSoftTissue: Significant oral soft tissue pathology or any type of gingival overgrowth, other than plaque-induced gingivitis and mild periodontitis (Stage I)
hasPeriodontalDisease: Moderate to Severe Periodontitis (Stage II, III and IV) based on 2017 World Workshop on the Classification of Periodontal and Peri-Implant Diseases and Conditions, which require: Detectable Interdental Clinical Attachment Loss (CAL) ≥ 3 mm at ≥ 2 non-adjacent teeth and Buccal or Oral CAL ≥3 mm with pocketing ≥ 5 mm detectable at ≥ 2 teeth.
PERIODONTITIS_BASED_ON: Moderate to Severe Periodontitis (Stage II, III and IV) based on 2017 World Workshop on the Classification of Periodontal and Peri-Implant Diseases and Conditions, which require:
DETECTABLE_INTERDENTAL: Detectable Interdental Clinical Attachment Loss (CAL) ≥ 3 mm at ≥ 2 non-adjacent teeth
BUCCAL_OR_ORAL: Buccal or Oral CAL ≥3 mm with pocketing ≥ 5 mm detectable at ≥ 2 teeth
hasFixedAndRemovedDentures: Removable dentures or fixed and removable orthodontic appliance (except fixed lingual wires)
hasHistoryOfAlcoholOrDrug: Significant history of alcoholism or drug abuse (other than tobacco/nicotine) within 24 months prior to screening, as determined by the Investigator
A_COURSE_OF_TREATMENT_WITH_ANY_MEDICATIO: A course of treatment with any medications or substances (other than tobacco/nicotine) which:
INTERFACE_WITH_CYCLOOXYGENASE: interfere with the cyclooxygenase pathway (e.g., anti-inflammatory drugs including aspirin and ibuprofen) within 3 days prior to each visit
ARE_KNOWN_TO_HAVE_ANTIBACTERIAL: are known to have antibacterial activity (e.g., antibiotics) within 7 days prior to each visit
havingTreatmentOfAnyMedication: A course of treatment with any medications or substances (other than tobacco/nicotine) which: interfere with the cyclooxygenase pathway (e.g., anti-inflammatory drugs including aspirin and ibuprofen) within 3 days prior to each visit and are known to have antibacterial activity (e.g., antibiotics) within 7 days prior to each visit

isRefrainFromScalingPolishing: Refrain from scaling and polishing procedures for the whole duration of the study (except for those provided in the protocol)
isAvoidOwnHabitualOralHygiene: Avoid modifying their own habitual oral hygiene (e.g., mouthwash, mouth rinse, interdental floss) for the whole duration of the study
isRefrainFromFlossing: Refrain from flossing for at least 72 hours prior to each study visit
isRefrainFromMouthRinsing: Refrain from mouth rinsing for at least 24 hours prior to each study visit
isRefrainFromToothBrushing: Refrain from tooth brushing for at least 2 hours prior to each study visit
isRefrainFromEatingDrinking: Refrain from eating and drinking (except water) for at least 2 hours before each visit
isAbstainFromSmoking: Abstain from smoking for 2 hours before each visit
isDoneQuestionnaireViaAppTracker: Complete questionnaire via the automated Tracker App during the entire period of the study
isAnyIntolerableAE: Participant experiences an intolerable AE. premature discontinuation will be at the discretion of either the Investigator or the participant, independent of the relationship of the AE to the study test product. The appropriate page for documenting AE in the eCRF must be completed
isDevelopedAnyDisease: Participant develops a concurrent disease which at the discretion of the Investigator no longer justifies the participant’s participation in this study
isDecidedToStopProcess: Participant decides to stop his/her participation
hasMajorProtocolDeviations: Major protocol deviations, that could lead to participants discontinuation from the study include: Protocol deviations which could affect the participant's safety (e.g., illness requiring treatment[s]) or which in the clinical judgement of the Investigator might invalidate the study, e.g., by interfering with the allocated test product or lack of willingness of the participant to comply with the study activities and/or oral hygiene instructions and The use of any nicotine/tobacco products other than the intended conventional cigarettes (in Arm A) or C-F NDS (in Arm B) and The use of any nicotine/tobacco products by participants in Arm C (never-smoked arm)
MAJOR_PROTOCOL_DEVIATIONS: Major protocol deviations, that could lead to participants discontinuation from the study include:
PROTOCOL_DEVIATIONS: Protocol deviations which could affect the participant's safety (e.g., illness requiring treatment[s]) or which in the clinical judgement of the Investigator might invalidate the study, e.g., by interfering with the allocated test product or lack of willingness of the participant to comply with the study activities and/or oral hygiene instructions
USE_OF_NICOTINE: The use of any nicotine/tobacco products other than the intended conventional cigarettes (in Arm A) or C-F NDS (in Arm B)
USE_OF_NICOTINE_ARM_C: The use of any nicotine/tobacco products by participants in Arm C (never-smoked arm)
isRefrainFromSmoking: Refrain from smoking or using any nicotine/tobacco product other than their assigned C-F NDS
hasReportedAnyChangeUsingDevice: Report any change in using their C-F NDS or conventional cigarettes (as per automated Tracker App)
hasReturnedAllEmptyProducts: Return all empty, partly used, and unused packs of heated tobacco products (HTP) consumables, and all used and unused consumables (tobacco sticks, e-cigarette cartridges, e-liquid refill bottles) at the times indicated in the Study Schedule of Procedures
hasReturnedStudyDevices: Return study devices, chargers and other accessories supplied to them for this study at the last visit
isRefrainFromUsingNicotine: Refrain from use of any nicotine or tobacco product other than their own conventional cigarettes brand
isRefrainFromUsingNicotineProduct: Refrain from use of any nicotine or tobacco product

NON_SMOKER_CIG_PER_DAY_NOTE: 0 number cig/day to be included in Arm C

isRegularSmoking: Regular smoking (≥ 10 cigarettes a day; for at least one year)
isAbleToComplyProcedure: Able to comply with all study procedures
havingHistoryOfDecompensation: Acute decompensation of Schizophrenia spectrum disorder symptoms within the past month
havingHistoryOfAlcoholism: Participants who have a significant history of alcoholism or drug/chemical abuse within 12 months prior to screening, as determined by the investigator
participatingOtherStudy: Participants who are still participating in another clinical study (e.g. attending follow-up visits) or who have participated in a clinical study involving administration of an investigational drug (new chemical entity) in the past 3 months prior to first product use
havingClinicalSignificant: Participants who have, or who have a history of, any clinically-significant neurological, gastrointestinal, renal, hepatic, cardiovascular, psychiatric, respiratory, metabolic, endocrine, haematological or other major disorder that, in the opinion of the investigator or their appropriately qualified designee, would jeopardise the safety of the participant or impact on the validity of the study results
isChangeInAntipsychotic: Change in antipsychotic treatment within the past month
havingHistoryOfHospitalization: No recent history of hospitalization for any serious medical condition within 3 months prior to screening, as determined by the investigator
havingMyocardialInfarction: Myocardial infarction or angina pectoris within 3 months prior to screening, as determined by the investigator
havingPoorAsthma: Current poorly controlled asthma or COPD
isAcceptingSmokingCessation: Accepting to take part in a smoking cessation program
isSmokingCessationTherapy: Participants who have used smoking cessation therapies (e.g varenecline, buproprion, or NRT) within 30 days of screening

reachingECigaretteScale: I find myself reaching for an e-cigarette without thinking about it.
urgeStrongECigaretteScale: My urges keep getting stronger if I don’t use e-cigarettes.
vapingECigaretteOutOfControlScale: My vaping is out of control.
vapingAfterWakeUpECigaretteScale: I usually want to vape right after I wake up.
coupleHoursWithoutVapingECigaretteScale: I can only go a couple of hours without vaping.
almostVapingECigaretteScale: I frequently find myself almost vaping without thinking about it.
eCigaretteFeelBetterWhenDownScale: E-cigarettes really help me feel better if I’ve been feeling down.
eCigaretteThinkBetterScale: Using e-cigarettes helps me think better.
aloneWitheCigaretteScale: I would feel alone without my e-cigarettes.
hardToStopVapingECigaretteScale: I would find it really hard to stop vaping.
hardToStopVapingForWeekECigaretteScale: I would find it hard to stop vaping for a week.
vapToFeelLessRestlessScale: After not using e-cigarettes for a while, I need to vape in order to feel less restless and irritable.
vapToExperienceLessDiscomfortScale: After not vaping for a while, I need to vape in order to keep myself from experiencing any discomfort .
last30DaysDifficultyKeepVaping: In the past 30 days, did you find it difficult to keep from vaping in places where it was not permitted?.
reachingCigaretteScale: I find myself reaching for a cigarette without thinking about it.
urgeStrongCigaretteScale: My urges keep getting stronger if I don’t smoke a cigarette .
smokingCigaretteOutOfControlScale: My cigarette smoking is out of control.
smokingAfterWakeUpCigaretteScale: I usually want to smoke a cigarette right after I wake up.
coupleHoursWithoutSmokingCigaretteScale: I can only go a couple of hours without smoking a cigarette.
almostSmokingCigaretteScale: I frequently find myself almost smoking a cigarette without thinking about it.
cigaretteFeelBetterWhenDownScale: Smoking a cigarettes really help me feel better if I’ve been feeling down.
cigaretteThinkBetterScale: Smoking a cigarettes helps me think better.
aloneWithCigaretteScale: I would feel alone without my cigarettes.
hardToStopSmokingCigaretteScale: I would find it really hard to stop smoking cigarettes.
hardToStopSmokingForWeekCigaretteScale: I would find it hard to stop smoking cigarettes for a week.
smokeToFeelLessRestlessScale: After not using cigarettes for a while, I need to smoke a cigarette in order to feel less restless and irritable.
smokeToExperienceLessDiscomfortScale: After not smoking cigarettes for a while, I need to smoke a cigarette in order to keep myself from experiencing any discomfort.
last30DaysDifficultyKeepSmoking: In the past 12 months, did you find it difficult to keep from smoking cigarettes in places where it was not permitted?.
NUMBER_OF_POD_RULE: Note: 1 pod/day for up to 10 cigarette/day, 2 pod/day for up to 20 cigarette/day, 3 pod/day for up to 30 cigarette/day

GENESIS_9002: Felt that people are against you
NO_COMMENTS: There are no comments yet on this issue.
COMMENT_SAVE: Opened comment needs to be saved
GENESIS_STUDY: GENESIS Study: A 12-month randomized, double-blind, controlled, international multicentre trial comparing changes in Cigarette consumption after switching to high or low nicotine strength E-cigarettes In smokers with Schizophrenia spectrum disorders.
ALTHOUGH_SMOKING: Although smoking it is rewarding for you, it is bad for your general health. It is also particularly harmful for people living with some mental health conditions. For example, smoking is associated with more depressive symptoms, increased stress, enhanced psychotic symptoms and poor response to antipsychotic treatments.
BY_STOPPING_SMOKING: By stopping smoking you could experience an overall improvement of psychiatric symptoms with less anxiety and depression with an overall improvement of your psychological quality of life. Moreover, you might be able to reduce the level of medications you’re taking.
CONSIDERING_WHAT_HAS_BEEN_SAID: Considering what has been said so far, quitting smoking will help manage your mental health condition better and contrast the development and the progression of smoking related diseases. No matter how much or how long you have smoked, quitting always helps your health in many ways.
QUITTING_MAY_NOT_BE_EASY: Quitting may not be easy, however. It has been suggested that for people not intending or not able to quit smoking, it is easier to substitute conventional tobacco cigarettes with combustion-free nicotine delivery systems (known as e-cigarettes) to achieve potential health gains.
GENESIS_STUDY_IS: GENESIS Study is investigating whether switching to these combustion-free nicotine delivery alternatives reduces your need to smoke tobacco cigarettes.
IN_PARTICULAR: In particular, the results of the study may help us to understand if switching to e-cigarette can accomplish high quit and reduction rates that persist long-term in people with mental health problems.
THE_INTENDED_MINIMUM: The intended minimum number of participants is 258 split into two arms – high nicotine devices (JUUL 5%) and low nicotine devices (JUUL 1.5%). The participants will be chosen from the volunteer population of adult smokers with Schizophrenia Spectrum Disorder will be recruited.
THIS_WILL_BE_MULTICENTER: This will be a multicenter, 12-months prospective trial, utilizing a randomized, double-blind, 2-arm parallel, switching design to compare effectiveness, tolerability, acceptability, and pattern of use between high (JUUL 5% nicotine) and low nicotine strength devices (JUUL 1.5% nicotine) in adult smokers with schizophrenia spectrum disorders. The study will take place in Italy and UK
PARTICIPANT_WILL_BE_RANDOMIZED: Participants will be randomized (1:1 ratio) to either high (JUUL 5% nicotine) or low nicotine strength devices (JUUL 1.5% nicotine) study arm. The two devices have identical appearances and will be assigned in a double-blind fashion. Study products will be provided for a total of 6-months (intervention phase); the intervention phase will be followed by a further 6-month observational period (follow-up phase) during which no products will be dispensed to participants. Throughout the follow-up phase and up to the final visit at 12-months, changes in smoking/vaping behavior and in their pattern of use will be tracked under naturalistic conditions and compared between study groups. Any changes in symptom severity related to schizophrenia spectrum disorders within and between both arms of the study will be monitored. The intervention phase of the study will consist of a total of nine visits (including screening). The follow-up phase will consist of three additional visits (two telephone contacts and one final face-to-face visit).
WHAT_IS_AIM_OF_GENESIS: What is the aim of GENESIS?
THE_AIM_OF_GENESIS: The aim of GENESIS Study is to test the hypothesis that switching to e-Cigarettes may accomplish high quit and reduction rates that persist long-term. Participants will be randomized to either high (JUUL 5% nicotine) or low nicotine strength devices (JUUL 1.5% nicotine) of identical appearance and assigned in a double-blind fashion. A much lower success rate is expected in the study group randomized to switching to low nicotine strength products compared to high nicotine strength. Besides effectiveness, tolerability, acceptability, and pattern of use of e-Cigarettes will be compared between study groups.
TO_MEASURE_OUTCOME: To measure the outcomes of self-reported continuous smoking abstinence at 6-month  from the screening visit and biochemically verified by exhaled CO measurements of ≤ 7 ppm (and other results accounted according to the collected data listed in the study protocol) in both arms of the study.
SECONDARY_OUTCOME: Secondary outcome measures will include quantitative within- and between-group variations from baseline of the following study endpoints:
ABSTINENCE_12_MONTHS: Proportion of continuous smoking abstinence at 12 month
REDUCTION_6_MONTH: Proportion of continuous smoking reduction at 6 month
REDUCTION_12_month: Proportion of continuous smoking reduction at 12 month
CALCULATE_OTHER_DATA: Calculation of other data listed in the study protocol
CONSEQUENTLY_THERE_IS_PRESSING: Consequently, there is a pressing need for alternative and more efficient interventions to reduce or prevent morbidity and mortality in smokers with schizophrenia spectrum disorders. A realistic alternative is to encourage these people to eliminate or substantially reduce their exposure to tobacco smoke toxicants by switching to less harmful sources of nicotine delivery (such as electronic cigarettes, tobacco heated products or snus) and select the ones that give the greatest probability of abstaining from smoking.
BEFORE_RANDOMIZAION: Before randomization, all smokers will be reminded of the risks associated with smoking and will be offered a free smoking cessation program according to standard local guidelines and depending on the local availability of antismoking services.
WHAT_DO_WE_DO_WITH_DATA: What do we do with the data?
USER_DATA_WILL_BE_USED: User data will be used by researchers to monitor adherence to e-cigarette daily use, daily consumption of traditional cigarettes, daily pod consumption, and their psychophysical state. As for their management will be the same as that of diasmoke and smile study
WHY_DO_WE_USE_MOBILE_APP: Why do we use the mobile app?
THROUGH_SELF_MONITORING: Through self-monitoring, users will be able to control their daily use of the electronic cigarette, the daily consumption of traditional cigarettes, the daily consumption of pods and their psychophysical state. They will receive motivational messages and will have the opportunity to contact healthcare professionals if they need their help.
THIS_WILL_BE_A_PROSPECTIVE: This will be a prospective 1-year study conducted in the ambulatory setting. Participants will attend a screening session followed by several follow up visits.
DOUBLE_BLIND: Double-blind, controlled, international multicentre trial.The study will consist of 3 phases:
SCREENING_AND_ENROLLMENT: Screening and Enrolment Phase (for study recruitment process)
INTERVENTION_PHASE: Intervention Phase (baseline visit followed by 8 visits-weeks 1,4,8,12,16,20,24)
END_OF_TRIAL_PHASE: End of Trial Phase (data analysis and dissemination of results)
SURREY_AND_BORDERS: Surrey and Borders Partnership NHS Foundation Trust
THE_INTENTION_IS_TO_DISSEMINATE: The intention is to disseminate the results of the study through journal articles in high-quality peer-reviewed journals and through conference papers. A summary of results will be available on the ECLAT/University of Catania’s website where patients and members of the public will be able to access it.
THE_END_OF_THE_TRAIL: The end of the trial will be the date of the last visit of the last patient in the last country undertaking the trial.
EXPORT_ALL_BETWEEN_SELECTED_DATE: Export all or between selected response date range
